intro: Hemisphaera besenginica, commonly known as the Malagasy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of the island. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface, while its stems are often hairy. Hemisphaera besenginica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
